instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Touch Bar Problems (no signs of liquid)
threads.message:
hello,   I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  I can not find any indication of liquid damage in any way.   The Touch Bar display works and is normal but it does not respond to touch.   I verified that the power rails to the touch bar are good.  I have no clue as to the data and do not have a touchbar laying around to test with.

Has anyone seen this?  Does anyone have additional insight to which data lines are for what and what they should look like?

Thanks
Randall

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Touch Bar Problems (no signs of liquid)
threads.message: I just had a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) with the same issue and found that <RESISTOR>R4453</RESISTOR> was missing from the board. <RESISTOR>R4453</RESISTOR> is a 0 ohm resistor that connects <SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_SPI_MISO</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_SPI_MISO_R</SIGNAL>. Once that was replaced, the touch bar started responding to touch again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Touch Bar Problems (no signs of liquid)
threads.message:
J4401 is for display and J4402 for touch function.
SPI communication is used for touch, so check all related resistors.
Don't forget to check reset and detect signals.
